allow: Bash(/opt/homebrew/bin/gh repo create thefiscalwire --public --description "The Fiscal Wire - News Website")
Bash(echo "Paste your Railway public DATABASE_URL and run: DATABASE_URL=""your-url-here"" npx prisma db seed")
Bash(PRISMA_USER_CONSENT_FOR_DANGEROUS_AI_ACTION="yes, you can import it back from my prodaction website" npx prisma migrate reset --force)

Bash(bash -c 'for sector in technology telecommunications health_care finance real_estate consumer_discretionary consumer_staples industrials basic_materials energy utilities; do
  count=$(curl -s ""https://api.nasdaq.com/api/screener/stocks?tableonly=true&limit=1&offset=0&sector=$sector"" -H ""User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0"" | python3 -c ""import sys, json; data = json.load(sys.stdin); print(data.get(\""data\"", {}).get(\""totalrecords\"", 0))"")
  echo ""$sector: $count""
done')

Finance rate limiting \(HTTP 429\). Added 60-second in-memory cache
to both /api/market/quotes and /api/market/movers endpoints, matching
the pattern already used in /api/stocks/[symbol]/quote.

data instead of an error when Yahoo is temporarily unavailable.

Bash(git -C /Users/olegrabinovich/Documents/ooo/newswebbyclaude commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add Finviz fallback for stock statistics when Yahoo fails

When Yahoo Finance is rate-limited \(429\), the Nasdaq fallback only
provides basic price data, leaving 50+ metrics as null. This adds
Finviz scraping as a secondary source to fill in:
- Valuation metrics \(P/E, P/B, P/S, PEG\)
- Profitability \(margins, ROE, ROA\)
- Balance sheet \(debt/equity, current ratio\)
- Ownership \(insider %, institutional %\)
- Technical \(beta, SMA50, SMA200\)
- Analyst targets and recommendations

Both sources are fetched in parallel for performance.
Finviz data is cached for 5 minutes.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C /Users/olegrabinovich/Documents/ooo/newswebbyclaude commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix SMA percentage calculation for Finviz data

Finviz returns SMA20/50/200 as pre-calculated percentages \(like -0.79%\),
not as price values. The frontend was treating them as prices and
recalculating, resulting in absurd values like -93844.83%.

Changes:
- Parse Finviz SMA values as percentages \(sma20Pct, sma50Pct, sma200Pct\)
- Add these new fields to the API merge response
- Update StockStatsTable to prefer pre-calculated Finviz percentages
- Fall back to Yahoo calculation if Finviz not available

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C /Users/olegrabinovich/Documents/ooo/newswebbyclaude commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix missing stock detail fields and SMA calculation bug

Issues fixed:
- SMA50/SMA200 showing absurd values \(-40549%, 1514%\) due to division
  by zero when Nasdaq API returns fiftyDayAverage=0. Added validation
  to require averages > 1 before calculating fallback percentages.

- Added missing growth fields to API merge response:
  - epsGrowthThisYear, epsGrowthNextYear, epsGrowthPast5Y
  - epsGrowthNext5Y, salesGrowthPast5Y, totalCashPerShare

- Fixed StockStatsTable hardcoded nulls to use actual Finviz data:
  - EPS next Y%, EPS next 5Y, EPS past 5Y, Sales past 5Y
  - Perf Year now uses perfYear instead of fiftyTwoWeekChange

- Added Cash/sh parsing to Finviz scraper

Now displays 15+ additional metrics from Finviz including performance,
growth, technical indicators \(ATR, RSI, Volatility\), and balance sheet.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C /Users/olegrabinovich/Documents/ooo/newswebbyclaude commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix advanced chart time formatting and Nasdaq fallback logic

Chart API fixes:
- Nasdaq fallback now only used for intraday periods \(1d, 5d\) since
  Nasdaq API only returns current day''s data, not historical
- Improved error handling and fallback flow

AdvancedStockChart fixes:
- Added formatTimeForChart\(\) to handle time formats correctly:
  - Unix timestamp \(seconds\) for intraday data
  - YYYY-MM-DD string for daily/weekly/monthly data
- Added deduplication to prevent Lightweight Charts errors from
  duplicate timestamps in data
- Improved "no data" UX with helpful message suggesting intraday periods
- Added barSpacing settings for better chart readability

Also updated CLAUDE.md with instruction to update ARCHITECTURE.md

Bash(git -C /Users/olegrabinovich/Documents/ooo/newswebbyclaude commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix chart cache to use period-specific keys

The lastKnownChartData cache was keyed by symbol only, causing 1D
intraday data to be returned for all periods \(1M, 6M, 1Y, etc\) when
Yahoo Finance is rate-limited.

Now caches are keyed by symbol+period+interval so each period has
its own fallback data.
